intro: Magnolia hypoleuca var. concolor, commonly known as the Chinese magnolia or the white magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its large, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The leaves are broad, ovate, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a rounded crown. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and parks.
